4.heading: The Tiki.
4.title: "La Route des Goëlands"
4.author: scénario, Sylli ; dessins, Ab Aigre.
notes: Summary from contents page of no. 37: Anyline finds the journal of her father, Victor Blanchenoud. This tells the story of his meeting with Cerisier, the painter, and Manuia, the native faithful to the charm and menace of the Tiki.

5.heading: The Tiki.
5.title: "La Route des Goëlands"
5.author: scénario, Sylli ; dessins, Ab Aigre.
notes: Summary from contents page of no. 38: The story of Blanchenoud shows us his return to Switzerland, the relations of his wife with Von Glütz, the end of his sanity. Despite his struggle to preserve his rights, he feels imprisoned by evil; science may prefer to believe in folly and ignore the Tiki...

6.heading: The Tiki.
6.title: "La Route des Goëlands"
6.author: scénario, Sylli ; dessins, Ab Aigre.
notes: Summary from contents page of no. 39: Accused of murder and locked up as insane, Blanchenoud spends his time making statues. Strangely, they recall the double curse of the Tiki.

8.heading: Tiki Fils de la Jungle--Miscellanea.
8.title: "Safari : Y'a pas Photo!"
8.author: Dominik Vallet
8.appears_in: text p. 69-78 in Cap'tain Swing, no. 112 (Juillet 2003).
notes: Describes the small-format comic book that published 169 issues from 1967 to 1987. Includes a biographical sketch of Claudio Tinoco (1920-) and descriptions of the major features in the magazine: Katanga Joe, Oncle Arthur, Johnny Speed, Klip et Klop, Bull Rocket, Jungle Jack, Teddy, Kid Pharaon, Le Cyclope, Flash Spécial, Tiki Fils de la Jungle, Simba le Fils du Fleuve, & Delta 99, with a list of minor features. Includes issue numbers and credits for the features.

191.title: 9 Timbres pour le 9e Art : Hommage : 10e Anniversaire du Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée
191.author: textes, Jean Auquier.

publication info.publisher: Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée

notes: Cancelled sheet of 9 comics-related postage stamps mounted on p. 5. Text includes illustrated articles on each of 8 strips and authors so honored: Corentin by Paul Cuvelier, Jerry Spring by Jijé, Gil Jourdan by Maurice Tillieux, La Patrouille des Castors by MiTacq, Hassan et Kaddour by Jacques Laudy, Buck Danny by Vic Hubinon, Tif et Tondu by Fernand Dineur, Timour by Sirius, and one stamp honoring the 10th anniversary of the Centre.
